definitions.definition: A soft or foolish person; an idiot.
Ellipsis of soft tyre (A tyre whose compound is softer than mediums, and harder than supersofts.)
A soft sound or part of a sound.
Easily giving way under pressure.
definitions.example: My head sank easily into the soft pillow.

definitions.definition: (of cloth or similar material) Smooth and flexible; not rough, rugged, or harsh.
definitions.example: Polish the silver with a soft cloth to avoid scratching.

definitions.definition: (of a sound) Quiet.
definitions.example: I could hear the soft rustle of the leaves in the trees.

definitions.definition: Gentle.
definitions.example: There was a soft breeze blowing.

definitions.definition: Expressing gentleness or tenderness; mild; conciliatory; courteous; kind.
Gentle in action or motion; easy.
Weak in character; impressible.
Requiring little or no effort; easy.
Not bright or intense.
Having a slight angle from straight.
definitions.example: At the intersection with two roads going left, take the soft left.

definitions.definition: Voiced; sonant.
Voiceless
(Slavic languages) palatalized
Lacking strength or resolve; not tough, wimpy.
definitions.example: When it comes to drinking, he is as soft as they come.

definitions.definition: (of water) Low in dissolved calcium compounds.
definitions.example: You won't need as much soap, as the water here is very soft.

definitions.definition: Foolish.
Of a ferromagnetic material; a material that becomes essentially non-magnetic when an external magnetic field is removed, a material with a low magnetic coercivity. (compare hard)
(of a person) Physically or emotionally weak.
Incomplete, or temporary; not a full action.
definitions.example: The admin imposed a soft block/ban on the user or a soft lock on the article.

definitions.definition: (of a man) Effeminate.
Agreeable to the senses.
Not harsh or offensive to the sight; not glaring or jagged; pleasing to the eye.
(of light) Made up of nonparallel rays, tending to wrap around a subject and produce diffuse shadows.
Emulated with software; not physically real.
definitions.example: Press the red button on the soft phone to hang up.

definitions.definition: Softly; without roughness or harshness; gently; quietly.
Be quiet; hold; stop; not so fast.
